item.description:
First Meetup Location at 845AM:  Sleepy's, 14 Allstate Rd Dorchester, MA 02125

Second Meetup Location at 845AM:  Dunkin' Donuts, 1500 Brayton Ave # 7, Fall River, MA 02721-5243

Third Meetup Location at 1030AM:  Dunkin Donuts, 419 Main Street, Southbridge, MA  01550

Fourth Meetup Location at approx 1145am:  Dunkin Donuts, 881 Windham Road, South Windham, CT  (we will meet the CT group here, fuel up, and continue on)

We are starting this ride early to try and beat out most of the traffic.  The 1st meetup location for the Boston area folks is 0845AM (leaving at 9am), riding down to the 3rd meetup location in Southbridge, MA for 1030am.  The folks from the 2nd meetup location in Fall River, MA will also leave at 0900 to meet up in Southbridge.  We will all group together at the Dunkin Donuts in Southbridge, MA where we will have a quick pre-ride meetup, restore our caffeine reserves, and head south down the twisties on Route 198 towards Norwich, CT to Route 82, then Gillette Castle.  This is an all day ride, so please plan accordingly.  We will not be rushing to get back, although we should all be home by dinner. 

Due to the number of riders, we will split into two groups.

1st group - more experienced or intermediate riders: knee-draggers, spirited, those at one with their machines, or more than 2yrs riding experience on the twisty roads.  Lead Rider - NavyCFL, Sweep - Gary

2nd group - intermediate or newer: 0-2yrs riding experience, slower, newer, or those experienced riders who just want to chill and enjoy the scenery.  Lead Rider - Shanks, Sweep - Corey

3rd group - intermediate or newer, same as above.  Need volunteer for Lead Rider, and Sweep.

Sweeper - one who follows the last rider in their group, takes care of any incidents that may occur, and keeps communication with the lead rider.

Note:  Please determine which group you would like to participate in prior to the pre-ride meeting in Southbridge.  The ride to Southbridge may be a good indicator of which group to join, and of course you are welcome to move up/down in each group depending on your comfort level.

This ride will be at a medium pace, nothing crazy, but there are some curvy roads to enjoy.

There will be plenty of places to join up or split up, just let us know at one of our stops so we are not thinking we lost someone.

We will stop to re-group at all road changes, with a sweeper in the back so we will not lose anybody.

I always recommend full gear.

There is no reason to push hard to keep up with anybody. (We much rather wait for you than wait for the paramedics). There should be a least 100ft between bikes at all times, single file, while going through twisty sections. Please take a moment and program ICE (in case of emergency) into your phone, with your emergency point of contact numbers. We are not planning on an emergency, but in case there is one, we want to be able to react quickly.

DISCLAIMER: By being a member of this group you hereby agree to assume all risks and liability related to or resulting from any and all group functions. You agree that neither you nor any third party will hold any of the group's Organizer or Assistant Organizers liable for any injury, loss, or damage to your own person or property arising directly or as a consequence from a group activity. You also agree that your membership of this group is based on an "at will" basis. See terms of service 6,6.1,6.2

Terms of Service
Please review

MSF Guide to Group Riding
Please review

Google Map
Please review

The town of Mystic was founded in 1654 and quickly rose to prominence as a shipbuilding center during the clipper ship era.

Nowadays, Mystic has become known for its quintessential New England charm, as well as its two world-class museums: the Mystic Seaport, the world's largest maritime museum; and the Mystic Aquarium & Institute for Exploration, featuring fascinating creatures from both sea and land, as well as the exhibits of Dr. Robert Ballard, discoverer of the Titanic.

Mystic Pizza
56 West Main Street
Mystic, CT 06355
860.536.3700

There should be some good views, so bring a camera. There is a gas station next to the Dunkin Donuts, so be fueled up, and ready to go. We will be leaving at 0900 sharp. Dress for the crash, not for the ride.

Note: There is a $4 charge to get over the Newport Bridge (unless you have EZpass of course) for those taking the bridge to RI on the way back home. There is a gate for the EZ Pass, so you must have the tag mounted, or with you. The route we have chosen should not have tolls, but please be prepared just in case.

Hope to see you there!
item.why: Kickstands up at 0900. Be fueled up, coffee finished, and ready to go for 9am. If your a late sleeper, meet us in Southbridge at 1030am, where will will have our pre-ride meetup, and coffee fix.
item.name: Mystic Seaport/Gillete Castle Scenic Ride 3.0/Joint Ride w/Boston Tier 1 Riders
